Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ori_haim
Reviews.Content: This hotel worth the money you pay. It is located 5 minutes walk from the central station Termini and you have many places to eat nearby. The rooms are clean and you can always ask question about what to do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Egidija L
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of the best budget hotels I have ever stayed in. The staff is veeery helpful, location is perfect, rooms are very clean, nice, comfortable, perfect bathroom. We have stayed at the end of February, 2012 so it was not the season and price was really low. I would really stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for Rome and 3*”
Reviews.Author: LM2097
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, it's a 3* but is clean and proper for the city and the level of italian hotels. Nice staff and location. It deserves the good rank it has.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brendon D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value! The service is good, especially if you are out roaming the city, there is always someone at the front desk 24/7. The staff is very knowledgeable of the area and will gladly help out and point you in the right direction. The location is perfect, it is a block from Termini Station! I recommend taking the metro into the Colosseum station, it is inexpensive and easier than walking. The rooms are very big, comfortable beds and large bathroom. I also recommend adding on breakfast for your stay because it is an inexpensive meal before going out sightseeing. The breakfast has coffee, juice, pastries, rolls, etc. Overall, I had an amazing stay here at this hotel and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, cheap and fab location for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: Oakley2012
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of January for three nights with my boyfriend. For the price per night (something like €40) this hotel is fab. Round the corner from the station and metro - sightseeing buses all stop at Termini so excellent if you are planning on being a total toursit like we were :) Walking distance to the Colosseum / Forum and a couple of nice restaraunts nearby; Giuseppes round the corner was the nicest. There's also a place called Tudini's nearby where they make a fab cocktail but the food was pretty average and quite expensive - lovely staff though including Tudini himself... they also have free wi-fi at both Guiseppe's and Tudini's so we went there to use the internet if needed as it's not available in the hotel. The local area is slightly 'Kings Cross' at night - if you are a city dweller then you're unlikely to be worried...but there are a fair few homeless people / odd charachters around after dark. We always felt quite safe though but wouldn't carry alot of cash etc as there are dodgy groups hanging around the station. We didn't have any trouble at all though so dont be put off. There's not a great deal to do of an evening but apparently this applies to Rome as a whole not just the Termini area. If you are sightseeing all day then you will probably be glad to have an excuse to have an earlyish night and a rest :D Hotel is nice enough, fab for the price. Breakfast was ok - just croissants and stuff but enough to fill you up til lunch. Staff were always really friendly. Rooms are cleaned and well equipped, not luxury but were certainly better than I expected for the price. For sightsee-ers - highly recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Mariano - Good value & location.”
Reviews.Author: tiastias
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Mariano in Jan, 12. Located 4min walk from termini station, Heard alot of negative comments about the terminiarea but we enjoyed it! not a ghetto at all and we always felt safe. The hotel is not Grand and flashy but it does the job and our room on 4th floor was really nice with a new bathroom and ac/tv etc.. staff is friendly and you get a map over rome when u check in. The location of Mariano is the best. 4min centralstation, 10min Colloseum, 20min fontana di trevi, etc.. Walking distance to everything even to the Vatikancity, about 40-50min Would stay at mariano again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nishababy77
Reviews.Content: Good for what it is. Friendly hotel staff, always willing to give you directions. 4min walk to Termini station, major sites not in walkable distance but ok as bus links and metro fantastically close to the hotel. Breaksfast was the same every morning, crosisants, bread, biscuits, selection of coffes, herbal teas and hot chocolate. Service is good. i stayed in room 502, very clean and modern looking. Do not expect 4 or 5 stars but it is a very nice 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget hotel for sightseeing in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: LimaYork
Reviews.Content: Firstly this is a budget 3 star hotel in rome so it's important to review it with this in mind and not expecting 4 or 5 star luxury! Yes the area is maybe a little bit run down but we felt safe enough and the location is perfect, especially if coming on terrevision bus shuttle from Ciampino airport as it is 5 mins away from the bus stop. The metro termini is just around the corner so brilliant transport all over rome, we chose to walk most places as only takes 10 mins to colloseum from this hotel. The staff were very helpful, room clean and large, no tea or coffee facilities in the room but not a big issue as had plenty at the breakfast. Overall, the rooms are clean, maybe a bit shabby in places but all of italy is a bit run down! For the price you pay (we paid £40 per room per night in December for B&B) we can not fault it at all and would definitely stay again. If you are more bothered about seeing the sights and not spending all your time in the hotel then this is the one for you, if you prefer luxury and everything spotless, then pay more and stay elsewhere. I think people expect too much for what they pay sometimes and complain about the most stupid things!

Reviews.Title: “Baited by another hotel, switched to this one”
Reviews.Author: Margaret A
Reviews.Content: Another hotel (Hotel Kennedy) said they were full, and moved us here when we arrived. I twisted my ankle en route to this hotel. We got to our room which was small but had high ceilings. My husband advised me to soak my ankle in the tub, but it was visibly dirty, and there was mold growing on it, so all I did was cry some more. He went to the front desk asking where he could get ice, and they looked at him like he had seven heads. They said they did not have any. He came back to the room and we took water bottles out of the minibar. We used those to keep the swelling down on my ankle. The room was dirty. Luckily it was a one-night stay. I slept on top of the covers, with my clothes on, because the whole room felt very dirty. There was also a hole in the ceiling. The bed was terribly uncomfortable. Both my husband and I woke up several times during the night because our limbs had gone numb. I was so glad I didn't have to stay at this hotel any longer. My standards aren't that high, but this was pretty bad. I will say that we did enjoy our continental breakfast in the morning, especially the blood orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “Room like a coffin, good location”
Reviews.Author: Ronim_lad
Reviews.Content: I think we got the most odd-shaped room (106). It was long and thin and it felt like a coffin. The lcoation was great for the train station, and walking distance to all major things in the centre. Water in shoer was hot, staff were friendly, we didn't have breakfast there so can't comment on that. Some hair in the bed when pulled back the covers, odd. Had to put two blankets down on the matress to make it comfy. The air con was good. Views of a back street, but then you're not really choosing this place for the views. All hotels were expensive in Rome and this was the cheapest we could find for a short break. Fine for a base.

Reviews.Title: “For people who will spend more time exploring Rome than in their room!”
Reviews.Author: luvlyliver
Reviews.Content: We arrived late September 2011, and stayed here for 4 nights to explore Rome. Walking up to the hotel, especially in the dark, we didn't get the greatest impression. However, inside, we realised it is your clean, run-of-the-mill, basic european city hotel. The best things about the hotel room are the comfy the bed, the air conditioning (which we had to turn off several times as it was working too well during the balmy nights!) and the shower (roomy, high pressured, and with working hot water, woohoo!). The breakfast is 5 euros, and a typical continental breakfast, with croissants, bread, cereals, and coffee. Staff were helpful enough. Checking in, we were given a map and told the best routes to walk to get around. The hotel seems to be in a chinese district of town. It is not scary at all like in some reviews I have read. There is a fabulous chinese restaraunt next door, which may look empty and less than inviting but try it! Me and my boyfriend had a big meal each with 2 huge bottles of beer, and only paid 17 euros! If you come to Rome to spend your days out and about, and just need a clean bed, shower, and a handy location to call base, do not hesitate to book this hotel. The price isnt bad, which leaves more money to spend on the amazing ice cream!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: StephanieBarski
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in this hotel for 1 night before we flew to Greece. It was close to the train station and the rooms were nice. Very weird hair dryers! There was a Chinese restaurant right next door, which was fabulous and CHEAP! The front desk clerks were very nice and helpful. One of them bought my extra Italy stamps that I didn't use (10 euro's worth!)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location and very dirty”
Reviews.Author: GarrettInAK
Reviews.Content: I arrived into the area by train at night and though the hotel was very close to the train station, the area felt very unsafe. There was many homeless people and other suspicious people around and I felt that my odds of getting mugged were high. When I arrived at the hotel the man at the front desk informed me that they accepted cash only which is crazy to me in this day and age. Well I was about 10 Euro short so he demanded that I go and get the cash at the nearest ATM at that instant, which was back at the train station and it was past midnight at that point. After returning I paid and went up to the room. The room was a decent size, though the bathroom very small. The water heater was tiny and so hot water ran out quickly. The worst part though was the dirtiness. The walls were covered in stains and the blankets were as well. Upon pulling back the covers to see the sheets the bed was covered in hairs, something I do not like at all. I would suggest finding a safer area of Rome if arriving at night and if cleanliness is a concern I would definitely avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guardado
Reviews.Content: Have almost only good things to write about the hotel. Staff were knowledgeable and helpful. The room we had on the fourth floor was very good. AC was controlled and quiet. The bathroom was large and clean. The breakfast was as feared small, but I had not expected anything else. Area the hotel is located in the undeserved bad reputation. Felt safe to walk to and from the hotel at all hours of the day. They were about 15 minutes walk to coluseum and the Fontana de Trevi (use the tunnel will save you at least 10 minutes). This is a great hotel if you need to chat a early flight, 500m to the Termini station.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R
Reviews.Content: Hotel was not in a nice area. Room had no decoration at all, was dark, cracks in the drywall, walls were thin enough to hear the television from a neighboring room. The kind of hotel that needs to warn travelers that "damages to linens will be charged to the room."

Reviews.Title: “Good deal on a quiet hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bigal78704
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival to Rome our hotel reservation fell through and we were forced to scramble for a hotel by the train station at 10 o'clock at night. We spent the night at the Quisisana for a cost of 85 euros. It was one of the least expensive hotels in the "termini" area, which is one of the cheapest areas to stay in Rome. This hotel,while serviceable, smelled bad and was not very clean. The next day, for the same price we found the Mariana Hotel. This was a big step up! The hotel welcomes you with a clean, modern lobby and friendly service staff. We booked a double room. The room was very clean and well decorated. We had cable TV and one of the best showers I'd experienced on my travels. The best part was that the area was very quiet at night as the hotel is situated on a nice, well lit plaza. Continental breakfast is included in the price. It wasn't anything too special , but it was better than your average continental in Italy. The only drawbacks would be that currently they are doing some minor construction on the building during the day ( after 10 AM) and you can here some of the early morning rush if you try to sleep in. Overall I would definitely reccommend this hotel. Especially if you are on a budget, but would like to stay somewhere decent and clean. We enjoyed it !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: greggie85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. We booked through an internet hotel booking service at 72 Euros per night. The rooms are compact but well appointed. They are also air-conditioned which you need in Rome in summer if you want to sleep well. The bathroom and toilet are very modern but smallish but were still okay. There is no fridge in rooms or internet access. There is a 24 hour receptionist so late arrivals are no problem. The hotel is only 3 blocks from the main train and bus station so it is an easy walk. There are numerous cheap restaurants in the area and at the station. There is a park across the road which is great for sitting down and relaxing. There is also a free wi-fi hot-spot in the park and at the main station. Breakfast was simple but ample for starting off the day. The automatic coffee machine made excellent coffee with lots of crema.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ALZ00
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, 5 minutes walking from the Termini Station. The reception staff is very friendly and the room is very large, although the bathroom is extremely small. The breakfast is very poor, and the staff of the breakfast room are very rude. Overall, I would stay again in this hotel for the great location and the cheap price, but would definitely skip breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here its all you need and more”
Reviews.Author: woodgnomeuk Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel good allround helpfull staff close to monuments public transport on the doorstep

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value for money”
Reviews.Author: AdeleandRay
Reviews.Content: Walkable distance from Termini easy to find all staff very friendly the guys on Reception very helpfull, giving useful info and directions with a smile. Our room was clean and tidy with good bathroom facilities. We found our travel kettle very useful. We had a front bedroom which had three beds a double and a single it was a little noisy in the morning if you had the window open, the back bedrooms are quiter but smaller. Overall we had a great time and very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Rose amongst thorns”
Reviews.Author: Thewilies
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, the room was large and clean and it was clearly obvious that it had recently been renovated as it seemed very new, we were on the 5th floor on the back which was recommended for a quiet stay, the view was not great but we were not there to look out a window all day. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times, and the location was a 5 minute walk from the termini station, make sure however that when you leave the station and turn left as instructed, you are at the very end of the station not the side entrance as you could easily go wrong. Our only criticism was the breakfast, was basically hard bread rolls, and very sugary croissants, and some cereal that looked like it had not been changed for ages. Be wary of the City tax that you have to pay in cash when you check out its 2 euros per person per night, there was a sign in reception when checking in to advice. Chinese food seems to be the norm around the area. Our The

Reviews.Title: “Every body were satisfied!!”
Reviews.Author: Kaveh80
Reviews.Content: We were 5 person of a family and traveled to rome from 6th to 11th of Jan. and had one double and one triple room. Every thing was over my expectation as i had read the reviews other people. The rooms were big enough, clean and with every thing we may need except refrigrator!!! room service was every day wiht new towels and soaps and shampoo!! Breakfast was good enough, cornflakes, variaty of coffees, juice,bread, cookies, jam, cheese, butter, chokolate, honey!! Also The location was near Termini!! I reccomnet this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to spoil your holiday, Go to this hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: nanachi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. We usually stay in the centre during our city breaks and we thought the location of this hotel was fantastic. It actually is centrally located close to the Termini Station. The receptionist told us that they would do us a favor and give us the exclusive room. the room was a bit bigger than a normal room but it was a horrible smell in the room coming from the bathroom. ( Like a dead rat ) We tried to take a shower but it took almost 15 minutes to get hot water. When I called the reception they said the water comes from the roof !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! we asked them to change our room that night but they said they did not have any extra rooms. The breakfast was only bread ( not fresh bread ) butter and jam. and crossaints left over from a week probably....Havent had such a horrible breakfast in a hotel in my life. next day they changed our room, was better but the smell from the first night had really put us off. The second day the waitress told us we hadnt paid for breakfast which we had to prove we had. The service , the hotel was all in all very disappointing. WASTE OF MONEY !!!!!!!!!!1

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: tdm1841
Reviews.Content: We have been to Rome many times. We usually rent an apartment. But, for 2 nights, over the expensive New Year, this hotel was great. Our rooms were quiet with comfortable beds and nice bathrooms. While not my preferred or recommended area of Rome to stay in, we were less than 10 minutes to the bus or metro at Termini and were quickly in the heart of the ancient city. So, not a bad choice near Termini or if this fits your budget.

Reviews.Title: “brill hotel”
Reviews.Author: mitchDorset_england
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mariano in the of Rome, great hotel very clean and the staff very friendly, the location is 100 metres from the Termini station ideal to travel by underground or bus. Only got ripped off once that was paying £6 each for a latte! Great weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “great budget base to discover Rome”
Reviews.Author: Versiliana
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome on a very short break to visit friends and do some more sightseeing (have been several times before) and needed a comfortable, convenient place to stay that wouldn't cost a fortune and the Mariano fit the bill exactly. We got great helpful service and were made to feel at home. The room was warm, clean and was a good size, even considering there was a full size extra single bed for my daughter (not easy to find in Rome, believe me). Very nice modern shower and bathroom in general. The decor of the rooms is classic modern day Italian but the building itself has its own quiet charm with its original marble stairs and exposed brick arched ceiling in the entrance and breakfast room. Breakfast served as a continental buffet, we loved the sweet Italian croissants. The Mariano is on a quiet square, not much traffic going by and the double glazed windows keep out everything! The original wooden shutters outside keep out the light so if you like a brighter room, swing them open. Being close to Termini is an advantage, not a disadvantage as no need to get stuck in a cab in traffic in those one-way streets - all you have to do is watch out for your purse, etc. in the crowds at the station but the same can be said around any busy train station in Europe...

Reviews.Title: “Located close to station & buses”
Reviews.Author: misscrackers
Reviews.Content: Centrally located within easy walking distance to the train station, buses and taxi services. Rooms were compact and clean and the bathroom although tiny was adequate. We had breakfast included in our tariff which consisted of cereal, pastries and toast, unfortunately one of our party is gluten intolerant and they did not cater to her needs. When we bought food from a nearby supermarket for her to have, they were reluctant to store it in the fridge and in the end only took the yoghurt and not the fruit. Staff were not overly friendly or helpful and the area was dirtier than a couple of blocks over but we didn't feel unsafe and walked arround day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Average place. But will not be there again”
Reviews.Author: Nice_vyvy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room while my friends stayed in a double room. The triple room is reasonable but the double room is very small and narrow. The bathroom is considered clean. It is located very near the termini station but the area seems a little rough. There are many asian shops and restaurants in the area. Far from tourist area and shopping districts. Breakfast is average. They provide cereals and bread for breakfast as mains. And provide coffee, hot chocolate, orange juice and milk for drinks. Most Dislikes: no internet and no wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Clean no frills hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Kendo_upendo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently located within 5 min walk of the Termini for train, bus and tram. It was an ideal base for walking to the heart of the City, the Colosseum was only 15 minutes walk away. It was very clean with plenty of hot water for the shower. The bedrooms had all the amenities you would expect in a three star hotel including a small safe. The rooms were very quiet and the bed comfortable. The reception staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. Breakfast was simple, a choice of 3 cereals, bread rolls, croissants, 2 fruit juices, jams, honey etc tea and coffee. They also arranged a competitively priced car to take us from and to the airport.. The area is not the best in Rome but it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “great location, dingy rooms!”
Reviews.Author: luti-lu
Reviews.Content: Despite this hotel being well located i.e. close to Via Republica, walking distance to the bus station and most sites the area seemed slightly dodgie! In saying that we felt safe but werent out that late. The rooms had a great heating system and a hot water shower. The beds were YUCK, lets be honest! Very suspect brown blankets and dated decor. It was however quite. Quirky staff and we were able to walk to all the big sites.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at the Hotel Mariano”
Reviews.Author: Lilion
Reviews.Content: Got stuck in Rome when the volcano in Iceland stopped air travel and spent several days at the Mariano Hotel. We chose it initally because it was the first one we found on the internet that was near Termini and under 150 euros a night. The cost was 120 per night and they were most accomodating to our situation. They happily kept our bags for us while we ran from train station to airport, trying to find transportation to France, as we kept having to check out and back in, but they found us rooms when it happened, though we did have to move twice. Mr. Mariano, the owner, was very nice and worked with us, even making calls to the airlines and translating the recorded messages regarding flights for us. The alos allowed us to use the hotel internet twice to transer money from our accounts, as we were leary of using the internet points to access our funds. He also recommended restaurants and made note of places we went to eat that we liked, presumably to recomend to others. Perhaps most importantly, at a time when other hotels were increasing their prices to take advantage of the stranded travelers, he not only did NOT do so, he condemed those business practices to us, stating he only raises prices during Christmas and Holy Week, even though he could do so other times, but that he felt it was just wrong. We couldn't have asked for a more pleasant, honest and helpful person. The rooms were all quite nice, not luxurious, but cozy. They were large and had windows overlooking the old aquarium building. While it was very close to Termini, it was also very quiet with the windows shut and we never heard street noise at night. Two of the rooms we had would have slept 4 easily, with two twins made into a king and another twin bed with a trundle underneath. The maids came daily and cleaned. The only complaint I would have is the hot water was very touchy and would go from boiling hot to barely warm without warning. Breakfast was included, served from 7 to 10 a.m. It was very basic, juice, coffee, tea, cereal, rolls and croissants. The Termini station area is not my favorite, but we never felt unsafe wandering around day or night. Some very good restaurants were nearby and cheap places for sandwiches as well. The area has a large ethnic population, with many middle-eastern and asian eateries and stores. This is not a hotel with lots of ammenities, no fitness center, no internet, no pool, no room service. But the lovely staff, convienient location and nice rooms all combine to make this a great place to stay if you just want a nice, basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back - this place exceeded my expectations - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: julened
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place to stay in Rome. It was a great value, the rooms were nicely decorated and clean, and the staff was very nice and accomadating. Serving us complementary coffees in the am and opening the bar in the pm for that late night bottle of vino. The best part of the stay was we could walk to major attractions and/or jump on the Metro to everyplace else. Having the train station right down the street was a huge bonus. I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay in this area again...probably not this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: work2travelTexas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was average. Pros: -Near main Termini station, about 2 blocks (which, by the way, is the only spot where the 2 metro lines meet and is the main train station). VERY CONVENIENT to get anywhere in Rome. I personally preferred the metro to buses, especially when the buses have nicknames like the "wallet eater". -Nice front desk staff. -A/C works well. We accidentally left it on and came back to a freezer! -Room doesn't need room key to have electricity. This is how we left the a/c on all day. -Near several restaurants, other hotels, and a small grocery by the train station. Cons: -Rooms need updating. Our room had upholstered walls that were moldy near the ceiling. -The breakfast was limited-coffee, juice, cereal, and rolls. Our other hotels in Europe offered more options which let us skip lunch and just have to pay for dinner outside of the hotel, not the case here. I read some reviews that said this was a bad area of town. To me, it felt about the same as the rest of Rome. I didn't feel unsafe but I wouldn't be out anywhere too late at night, not just around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: brk69
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Family owned and operated. Very close to bus and train station. Clean and perfect for sightseeing and being able to jump on the train/bus to get around Rome.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: noushaa
Reviews.Content: friendly atmosphere , close to Termini station, basic breakfast, I didn't like the decor of the room, too dark. moderately priced

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: emilyluvlee
Reviews.Content: it had some charm and interesting decoration very close to Termini station for metro's. Walking distance to Collessuem,

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but the facilities reflect this”
Reviews.Author: Tina093
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location if you want to be near Termini however the area was not the most desirable and I felt unsafe going out with a child during the evenings. The road the hotel was on was disgusting and the noisiest place I have ever stayed - with bin collections at midnight and a women screaming every night for at least an hour in the churchyard opposite. The room on the whole was fine as was the breakfast but the shower was disgusting. The shower curtain was mouldy and the water didn't drain properly so you were standing in your own dirt. There was also mould on the bedroom wall from the bathroom. Room is not cleaned properly either, beds are made that is it. The staff were generally helpful depending who was on duty but anything extra like buying refreshments was a great hassle as reception staff did it for you but often too busy and got annoyed with you asking. Not a great place to stay if you have kids.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst place I've ever stayed at in my life.”
Reviews.Author: cdiana12
Reviews.Content: The shower was disgusting with the bottom of the shower curtain being full of mold. The wallpaper near the bathroom fluffed out because of all the mold behind it. They told us it slept 4, but what they really meant was two futon like beds pushed together with a twin and a fold out cot. They made us return the key whenever we would leave and arrive. Our room was for 4 and we would often split up to go places so if two of us would ask for the key when the other two already had the staff would immediately think we were trying to stow people in the room and start interrogating us on how many and who was already in the room. The location was horrible, I was afraid to come back after dark because of how seedy the area was. The restaurant downstairs was never open and the staff watched everything you did. My friend was staying in a single downstairs and when the cleaning staff saw both of us come out of the room they started interrogating us on what we were doing with 2 people in one room. When we left, we left 1 person behind to check us out of the room and the check-in desk guy literally chased after us to the train station asking for the key, even after we told him there was still someone in the room. This was at 6:30 am when check out wasn't until 11am. Then he banged on the door to the room while the last of us was still sleeping and barged in screaming. He automatically assumed there had been more than 4 people in the room without ever seeing more people in the room and my friend gave him the key, pakced up his stuff and walked out at 6:30am with nowhere to go. As my friend walked out the desk worker still screamed at him and called him a "[--] American" on the way out. Please do not stay here, these people should not be allowed any more business, in fact they should be closed down.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: whatdidtheromans
Reviews.Content: The Mariano is quite expensive for what you get. The hotel rooms are clean, and the bathrooms look like they've been recently refitted so are spotless and modern. The room wallpaper though is a bit hideous and the rooms are small. Good aircon though. The breakfast is towards the more minimal end of a continental breakfast, although you can still fill yourself up. There is a choice of cereals, some bread, jams etc, a "juice" machine, but that's about it. There isn't the usual choice of meats or cheeses. You can though ask the staff for any type of coffee freshly made. The best part about the hotel is its location. Being just south of the main railway station, I was expecting a bit of a dodgy area. However, it is actually very pleasant, in the heart of Rome's China Town, with lots of clothes shops run by Chinese and genuine Chinese restaurants catering for locals at good prices (try the one right next to the hotel - don't be put off by the plastic tables and tableclothes). Diagonally opposite from the hotel across the crossroads is an excellent Korean basement restaurant - Hana, Piazza Manfredo Fanti 15. Get the inclusive dishes which come with an array of small dishes of pickled vegetables. With the train station being at the crossing point of the city's two metro lines and a major bus terminus you are ideally suited to travel the city.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: PerthAussieFamily
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of hotels and have never written a negative review before but this place was shocking to me. It was in a very seedy area, we saw drug deals and had unconscious people near our hotel. The area is the ghetto of Rome. The room size was small but fine, the walls were covered with dirt, the bathroom roof and walls were covered with mould and the rooms stank. The service was unhelpful and the only assistance we got was being repeatedly told that we needed to leave our room cards at the hotel, due to the bad area surrounding the hotel. We couldn't eat breakfast due to how dirty we found the hotel and the food was stale and both of the 2 options were inedible to us. After 3 star hotels in France, England, Greece and Spain, this hotel was nothing more than a backpacker hotel, and backpackers were the only other guests I saw stay here. The TV we had had no reception on the one English speaking channel. There was no little fridge (very difficult in such a hot place) and the safes in our room did not work, which was a concern considering the area the hotel is in. For a family I found this hotel totally inappropriate, it was dirty, smelly, and in a dangerous neighbourhood not near tourist attractions, and only good for those catching a train. The hotel was very noisy, and walking home at dusk was something we didn't try more than once with children, getting back early became a priority for safety. There must be worst hotels, I just hope I never have to experience them, as this was the worst place I would ever hope to see.

Reviews.Title: “This was our second visit and we'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: MegDav
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here in mid March. The location is excellent,only two streets from Termini. The hotel is actually on Via Rattazzi,overlooking Piazza M. Fanti and was a little difficult to find last time we stayed there. The hotel address doesn't give a street name.Our room was on the first floor as requested,it is spacious by Rome/European standards and the bathroom is quite big. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Our only problem was that our shower base kept filling up with water and the hot water was often cold. Persistent gentle complaining eventually had the problem sorted. For laundry and internet, there is a fantastic service called "OndaBlu" in Via Principe Amedeo two blocks towards Santa Maria Maggiore. Virginia is the lady in charge and she is the most delightful,helpful lady. The internet rates are pretty good too.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, no net, minimalist breakfast, tile floors, inconsistency re: smoking”
Reviews.Author: zippy47
Reviews.Content: Good things: the AC worked great, and the hotel is on Piazza Manfredo Fanti, a little parklet surrounding an old cistern -- it was relatively quiet, even on the first floor facing the street, and there was a view of green, which is rare in this part of Rome. It's also on the south side of termini, relatively close to the otherwise very inconvenient track from which the train to the airport (the Leonardo Express) departs. Bad things: the breakfast (more below), no internet access at any price, minimal amenities. The room, booked as a double on booking.com, turned out to be a triple with a fourth folding bed conveniently at hand. The room had fabric-covered walls and tile floors. Amenities were minimal: there was no Kleenex, nevermind a kettle or coffee maker. The mattresses had little toggles (much like a futon), but they could only be felt on the half of the mattress not covered by the mattress pad. Pillows were flat, and the bedspread reminded me of the cheap polyester things seen in cheap US hotels. Despite this uninspired bedding, I slept very well. The room had a small safe. Rooms used chip-card keys which they asked to have left at reception when going out (= no real security for the room). Breakfast included croissants, rolls, two varieties of (packaged, not fresh) juice, and cereal. The milk was reconstituted from powder, and there were no cheeses, cold cuts, eggs, or other protein. The spreads included an off-brand Nutella substitute. Summary: I'd happily stay here again if I were taking the Leonardo Express train, but, given the breakfast and lack of net, I wouldn't choose it for more than a one night stay. And given the unreliability of the Leonardo Express, I'd rather stay elsewhere in Rome and pay the flat rate taxi fare of 40 Euro to get to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel and a Righteous Price”
Reviews.Author: emilee_leblanc
Reviews.Content: The Mariano Hotel is a three-star hotel near Termini Train Station. Perfect location for those arriving and departing by public transport. As others have described, the rooms are small, clean, and quiet and the bathroom relatively nice. Breakfast is basic, but fine. The desk staff ranged from incredibly helpful to not helpful at all. We booked through Venere.com and were quoted a price significantly less than on the hotel's own website. I was a bit worried about this, but there was no problem at check in or check out. There is a lovely historic building across the street with the added benefit of a small park. The area is of mixed ethnicities and, while not the most elegant in Rome, feels quite safe--even late in the evening. There are several historic sites near by and the Coliseum is easily walkable. As other reviewers have noted, all subways and many bus routes pass through Termini, so it is easy to move around the city and end up close to the hotel. An excellent budget choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: andy191251
Reviews.Content: We were told the Termini area was seedy but we found it OK and the fact that all the buses trams underground stopped/started there made the location perfect. The hotel was clean, quiet and the staff were very friendly. Breakfast was fine. All in all the right spot for a long weekend sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandra-newquay
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Hotel Mariano from the 20th-27th dec '08 and found the hotel brilliant, room was lovely,clean the only way they could improve would be to have tea,coffee facilities in room cos us brits love a cuppa at the end of the night! bed very comfy ,room cleaned every day. Breakfast was continetal buffet and was lovely! all the staff were friendly and very helpful and we really liked Giovanni he was so lovely and helpful was a pleasure to meet him and were very grateful for his help and advise! a very good base to explore the city and very close to train,metro and bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Good and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen079
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a must for who intends to use the metro as is it only a street away from the station. Apart from that, Termini station is the main connection not just for Rome but for the train connection around Italy. It was very easy for us to continue our holiday in Naples for example. Regarding the hotel, the staff is very friendly and the receptionists speak very fluent english. We had a very nice welcome, we were given a map on which the receptionist highlighted all the important landmarks of Rome. It was of great help to us. The rooms are rather small but enough to feel comfortable in it. Both the hotel and the rooms are very clean. Breakfast is basic which means fresh croissant and bread, biscuits, orange juice, tea and coffee. Jams, butter, spreadcheese and others are at your choice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who needs a basic accomodation because you would have a pleasant stay in Rome for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Basic But Good!!!”
Reviews.Author: Justified1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for anyone who wants to travel for a short duration of time, and is travelling on a budget. The hotel is very basic, but still has all the necessary amenities to provide a comfortable and enjoyable stay!!! The rooms are clean and cosy, although they are largely small. The interior is not particularly extravagant, but it is well decorated none the less!!! The staff are generally very helpful and friendly, but the initial welcome on the first day was a little cold! The breakfast selection here again, is rather basic, but still good enough to kick start your day!!! One of the greatest benefits of this hotel is that it is small, and private, so you don't have to worry about the noise, and bustle of fellow stayers!!! As for the location, the Mariano is in one of the seedier parts of Rome, but is still central to the main attractions, majority of which are within close walking proximity. The hotel is also close to the Termini station which is useful if you wish to travel out, or if you're just not much of a walker!!! Overall, I had a pleasant stay; the rooms were comfortable and clean, the location was within good range of all major attractions and the staff were polite and lovely!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bolton_Boy_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good. It is located close to the main train station in Rome. It seems to be in the Chinese district and although there were a few randoms hanging around in the surrounding area sometimes, we didnt feel threatened at any point and nobody ever approached us. The hotel had very friendly staff who were happy to help at any point during our stay. The hotel is an ok walk from the Colosseum but Vatican City is probably a bit too far to walk (especially in the heat). We solved this by booking a 2 day pass on the City Sightseeing bus which allows you to hop on and off all day. This was useful to see the further away sites. The room was fairly small but still sufficient, the ensuite was clean and large enough. Breakfast was typical continental but there was enought choice with cereals, croissants etc. Rooms are secure with CCTV in the corridors, a receptionist who seemed to be there all of the time and a keycard system to enter the rooms. I would definately recommend this hotel as a good place to see the sites of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: IrelandEileen
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and myself stayed in this hotel in may for a 4 night break. I booked it on the hotel website and when we got there they did not have a record of the booking even though i had a confirmation received. This hotel is a three star, centrally located, breakfast not great, cereal , juice, tea or coffee but ok. You get what you pay for. There are 4 star hotels up the street from this hotel. But you can walk to most of the attractions from this hotel. Basic but ok.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: msboodle
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the stay. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The elevator was a huge help with heavy luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaz112
Reviews.Content: Superbly clean. Exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. Well placed hotel, which is close to amenities, yet surprisingly quiet and peaceful. Would recomend to anyone who wishes a well priced and good quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not great either, fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: jes_987
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Mariano, the price is reasonable for the service. The room was clean and mainly peaceful. On arrival we had problems with a double reservation, but it was cancelled without frills, the people at the desk were always helpful. The zone does not look well but seems to be safe. It is close to the main station of Termini, which is very handy for transportation purposes. On the minus side, the breakfast was unimpressive (yesterday's croassants, no cheese, Ham, or real juice in offer). and for times the room was cold, there is heating available in the room, but nobody bothers to explain you how to use it, I had to spent half an hour working it out. I'd come back if I'll stay in Rome for a short time and I want a cheap and well located option.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: MzTravelDiva
Reviews.Content: Friends and I stayed here for 3 nights. We really enjoyed how close the hotel is from the Termini station. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was nice/clean and a good size considering it was a triple. The only drawback was that there temperature control in the shower was out of wack. The water would go from piping hot to very cold with the slightest touch of the knob. Also, the sink needed plunging. The hotel is undergoing renovations, so perhaps these issues will be resolved then. All in all we enjoyed our stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KateVLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through hostelbookers. Great hotel. The staff were helpful and friendly and spoke good english which was a bonus as our italian is very limited! It is really close to the train station and although the area isnt the best, felt quite safe walking around at night (we are two women). Its easy to walk everywhere from the hotel. Great breakfast Would definitely recommend this hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value but read on for info about taxi fares from airport”
Reviews.Author: UkRomavisitor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Mariano with a group of 9 colleagues. We were on a tight budget and basically wanted a nice hotel at hostel prices - a big ask in Roma. Luckily I managed to find Hotel Mariano on the hostelbookers website & got a very good deal. I've read other reviews commenting on the dodgy area the hotel is in, but we didn't notice this, perhaps because we weren't there on a Friday or Saturday night. It's handy for the trains/buses/metro etc. or if you don't mind walking to the main attractions. The hotel itself is very clean, beds are comfortable, bathrooms are small but have a good, hot shower and/or bath. The 4-bed rooms are 3 singles & a fold-down bed which you wouldn't want to sleep on for more than a couple of nights. The porter, Giovanni, was very helpful, booking a nearby restaurant for us when we arrived late on the first night due to flight delays & even arranging for a musician to play for us there because he'd noticed on my passport it was my birthday. HOWEVER, please note that taxis from Ciampino Airport to anywhere in central Rome are a fixed 30 EURO rate & the same on the way back. Giovanni tried quite hard to persuade us to book 3 taxis back to the airport at a cost of 40 EURO or more each & didn't seem to have heard of the fixed rate. When I was politely insistent, he phoned the taxi company & agreed, with surprise, that it was just 30 EURO. We also confirmed the rate with each driver before getting in the taxi & had no problems. Generally speaking, try to have an idea of what your taxi will cost, check the meter is on & watch it throughout the journey. We got 2 taxis to the same destination & one group was charged twice what the other one was.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for......”
Reviews.Author: josephine28
Reviews.Content: I went direct to the hotel to book, which was cheaper than going via one of the hotel booking websites. The hotel it self is ok. It is very basic but you get what you pay for it. It was basically clean but there were tell tale signs that it needed a bit of a tidy up - there was mould in the bathroom, the bedroom furniture was chipped and the drawers didn't open propertly. That said, it was perfectly adequate for what we wanted. The area didn't seem the most desirable at first but once you're there, you realise that you are perfectly safe. It is literally a 5 minute walk from the station so it's really handy. The breakfast is basic, (bread and jam and some cereal), but perfect for getting something in you before you start walking. I wouldn't go on the bus tour - it takes you round all the main sites and costs about 19 euros. For 4 euro's you can buy a ticket from the train station which lets you go on all public transport until 12 at night. Much better on the pocket. Would also recommend that you go to a football game- great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A quick stop in rome”
Reviews.Author: mandyk21
Reviews.Content: A hotel with a nice reception area, the place is being done up (I think) and the doors are alot nicer than the rooms inside! Our room was clean but basic, the shower was impossible to use without flooding the bathroom. There is no room service so no way you can get a cup of tea in the morning. The breakfast waitress was so lovely it made up for everything else, for a continental breakfast it was the best we had on our travels. This hotel is ok for a cheap stopover, clean and functional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Find”
Reviews.Author: JJLF
Reviews.Content: The Mariano was a perfect hotel for our overnight stay in Rome. It's convenient to the rail staion; located on a narrow street about 2 blocks away. There is local traffic in the morning but wasn't disturbing to us. Our room was clean and large with a double bed and a twin along with a desk, chair and ample wardrobe. The bed and pillows were comfortable. There was even a small refrigerator in the room. The bathroom was small but adequate for our stay. Had we stayed longer we still would have been perfectly satisfied. Our traveling companion had a single room of the same standard, the only difference being the room was much smaller but perfectly adequate for a single traveler. The front desk staff spoke excellent English and was very helpful on every shift. They arranged a bus tour for us prior to our departure the next day at competetive rates. Breakfast was served in the room adjacent to the lobby and included the standard Italian fare - more than enough to jump start your day. We arrived after 9:30 pm and we hungry after our long flights. Two doors down the street to your right is a little restaurant that is owned by the hotel. We had a good light meal there at very reasonable rates. We would recommend the Mariano Hotel to anyone looking for clean, comfortable stay in Rome. We wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: Edsco
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mariano Piazza Manfredo Fanti, 19 Rome, Italy Check-In Date: Sat, Jun 2, 2007 Check-Out Date: Wed, Jun 6, 2007 Convenient location and within walking distance of all sites in Rome. My room was large with a double and a twin bed. I used Priceline with a bid of $150.00 USD incl. breakfast x 4/nts. The hotel was central for everything that I wanted to see. The hotel is a 5 min walk from the main train station/Ryan Air bus drop-off from Ciampino Airport. Check-in was a breeze. Pics listed in my profile.

Reviews.Title: “heplful & kind in a big city....rome”
Reviews.Author: carMlps
Reviews.Content: rome can be a bit scary for the first time traveller there, we found this quaint charming hotel just a few blocks from the train station,termini... there are many hotels in rome but this is dead center, close to everything we wanted to see...so it was easy with the help from the english speaking staff to get oriented in such a big city. the colosium was just down the street. we enjoyed clean rooms and a great continental breakfast in the mornings ...and check out the resturant next door ... we ordered the pasta house special and it was too die for!!!!!WE'LL BE BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Hotel close to Train Station...”
Reviews.Author: mjogg11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mariano Hotel from December 26th through January 1st. Let me just say that there were pros and cons to the hotel. When we arrived at Termini Station we were pleasantly surprised to find how close the Mariano was. We were able to walk about 2 blocks to the front door of the hotel. Upon arrival the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful in providing restraunts and area information. The room itself was basic, but provided a comfortable bed and a hot shower. It was very clean and always clean every day when we returned. There was also a safe in the room to protect any valuables. The room itself was larger than we had anticipated and was easily large enough for both my wife and I. The close proximately to the train/metro station made it easy to get to different points in the city. What we weren't very impressed with was the area around the hotel. I will say we never felt threatened or even unsafe, but this isn't the normal tourist area that you would expect a hotel to be in. To put it in perspective imagine any large city and the area around a train station or subway station. It is dirty and not generally the most desirable area to be in. It only takes a block, in the right direction, to get to a main street that is more touristy and leads to Santa Maria Majorie. Overall, we were content with this hotel. If you aren't expecting a hotel with lots of ammenities and are willing to deal with a couple of blocks of dirty area this hotel will suit you fine.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Hotmamma78
Reviews.Content: Thought this hotel was okay. It was a little pricey for a 3 star hotel...i'm sure we could of found something a little more central in Rome for a little more than what we paid when you start to add up taxi prices and bus fares. The room is very small so don't go there expecting the Hilton or the Ritz! The location is alright it's very close to the train station which is pretty easy to find. My husband and i got lost coming in and it seems the hotel is located in Rome's "China Town" which i didn't know they had anyhow the area around the hotel is somewhat okay not the safest but when your in Rome you always need to watch your stuff. The bathroom shower was horrible though....the water pressure was nonexsistent and the water started to come out a little brown I had to wait awhile for it to turn to normal. The Breakfast was a typical European breakfast...nothing major...crossants, juice (which is really concentrated and sweet), toast crackers, jam and cheese. Don't think I would reccomend this to a friend or a family member..but if your looking for somewhere to stay that's near the train station and just need a place to sleep and shower this place would be for you!

Reviews.Title: “not 3 star”
Reviews.Author: SarahMD
Reviews.Content: The staff were very pleasant and helpful and the rooms, while definitely not of a high standard (and extremely small!), were clean and the beds were comfortable - good enough when you're out sightseeing all day. The main problem was the lack of water pressure. Showers were a matter of 'catch the drops' and as mentioned by another reviewer, the shower curtain is completely inadequate in keeping what little water came out from flooding the rest of the bathroom. I wouldn't recommend this hotel during summer since there didn't seem to be any way to cool the room down, otherwise, it's a reasonably priced place to sleep while you stay at Rome. Breakfast was average - unfortunately they give you powdered milk.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: Seein'_the_world
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here after our cruise. The travel agent called it a 3-star hotel and we certainly paid enough for a luxury hotel but got neither. The room was large for a European hotel but the decor was garish. The mattress was thin and lumpy. The sheets were thin with cigarette burns and holes. The bath tub had mold. The shower curtain was only about half the length of the tub. The floor needed to be swept. There were no real chairs in the room, just a low wooden bench and a stool that went to the desk (which couldn't be used because it was the TV stand). The room had a high ceiling but was still hot and stuffy. One desk clerk was helpful with tour information. The later desk clerk (whom we caught drinking on the job) was not helpful after we were robbed on the subway. We needed information and assistance with the telephone, but he insisted he could not help us. Later when we had info from the US Embassy, he asked if he could have a copy. After this we heard him recommend the subway to a young couple with no warning about thieves. We paid for breakfast with our room but the shuttle to the airport came before the breakfast room opened. (We missed dinner as we were robbed of our Euros and credit cards so we were hungry.) No credit was given for the missed breakfast either. The first clerk told us phone calls were 20 cents. The morning clerk insisted the three local phone calls were 1 Euro apiece. We had a two-Euro coin which he took then marked the ledger PAID. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Rome-Fan
Reviews.Content: We have just come home from a 10 day stay in Rome, and I'd recommend the Mariano Hotel to anyone. We had excellent service, great, friendly and helpful staff a very enjoyable stay. A big thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not Three Stars But Close to the Termini”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-Traveller3121
Reviews.Content: When booking a room at the Mariano, we were not expecting five star accommodation, but overall, this hotel is not worthy of a three star rating. On arrival, despite having booked our room six months previously, we were told that our double room was not available that night and we would have to change rooms the next day. The room was clean, but very small and certainly no frills - except air conditioning. However, the airconditiong was a separate free-standing unit, very noisy and cut out during the night (you have to empty the water from it). The bathroom was surprisingly good and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast was included, which included some breakfast cereal and bread rolls but very little else. The hotel is closely located to the Termini (main train station), which was our reason for choosing the hotel, but this area is very dirty and seedy and is not one of the choisest neighbourhoods in Rome. If you are looking for a bed to sleep in and not much else, then this hotel will suit you. It should not have a three star rating and next time I think I would rather pay more for a better quality area and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you need a place to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: rockytherockstar
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 day trip to Italy. This hotel is a tough to review because it serves itself well. Italy hotels are what they are...small and simple. Don't expect that rockin' bed and shower you had at the Westin in Fort Lauderdale last trip, etc, unless you are ready to pay a very hefty price for it. Our room was clean, quiet and the bathroom seemed to be brand new. The staff was helpful and willing. The bed was firm and the pillows are very very thin as they were at all the hotels during our stay. If you want to stay near the Termini, there are plenty of hotels in the area that would make you feel more comfortable. We dined on Amadeo a few nights and the walk was straight down to the hotel. The last two blocks you have to walk are seedy and the area around the Piazza smells of urine and is lined with trash cans. If I'm on a trip with some buddies in Rome, yes I'd stay at this hotel. If you are not a city person then do not as the last few blocks may have you looking over your shoulder. Stay further up the street. Location to Termini is fantastic and the major tourist bus routes originate there. The restaurant right next to the hotel is fantastic and very well priced.

Reviews.Title: “good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: fatface99
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The location is great although the surrounding area is grotty but busy at all times so there is no need to feel unsafe. I was travelling in a group of 3 females and we felt safe at all times. Pickpocketing is big in rome so as long as you keep your bags close to you at all times you should be fine. The room was really big and clean and the bathroom was great. The staff at the front desk were helpful too. The only negative I have about the hotel is that the breakfast was not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the conclusion of our Italian 3 week adventure. Hotel staff could not have been more friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. The room was a double, very large, clean yet very plain. My only concern was with the strange and the very unsafe looking aircon unit with the vent poking out the window. It did not work very well, but we did stay in the peak of summer when it was over 40 degrees celcius. The location is VERY handy. Taxi rides to Piazza Navona was like 8 euro. Location though, was scary, even during the day. I would have hated it if I was travelling alone. We had a drug addict overdose across the road on footpath next to big park who was being resuscitated by ambulance officers. Laundremat is close by, strong stench of urine all around the hotel street. You are safe as long as you just are aware at all times. If you are to travel with luggage to Termini, as we did, is VERY VERY handy location. Easy to walk there with full suitcase each. We didn't eat much here, but Ristorante next door was really lovely and worth a try. Although quite scary neighborhood, was a good reasonably priced choice that suited our needs. Believe me,in 5 weeks we had stayed in worse. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better for a 3 star but OK”
Reviews.Author: Loopy-Doha
Reviews.Content: Could have been nicer for a 3 star. Dated but clean and the reception staff were quite friendly. Close to Termini Station (2 mins walk) which was very handy as the bus from the airport dropped us off there at midnight. Reception was still open. Breakfast was OK: bread, cereal, tea and coffee etc but not really worth bothering with. In summary was OK but could probably do better for the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: zeeba1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible. It is located on the dodgy side of the Termini train station where graffiti is sprayed on buildings and the streets are rough. We were frightened walking during the daytime! The room was a disgrace , thankgoodness we only needed a bed for the night. The noise coming from the children and neighbours next door was easily heard through the walls til late. I did not like the fact matches were left on the bed , an easy way for children to start a fire. Breakfast was of a very poor standard , stale cereal , just dreadful. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Detailed Description- You Choose”
Reviews.Author: kshangil
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Mariano on 9/28 and 9/29/05. After reading the reviews, my husband and I (both 29 yrs old) were very skeptical as the reviews for this hotel seemed extreme. However, I will provide the facts and you can decide what may be important to you. We booked through a name your own price website for $143USD per night. Therefore, the room was booked as two people in single beds. After requesting a double, the accomodating staff (who may be the owner) put us into a room with one double and one single facing the street. The hotel did have an elevator. The satff spoke very good English and were very friendly. We found that the wallpaper was peeling. The bathroom had a strong oder of bleech. The sheets and towels were clean and white. The water was hot and included a hand held shower with ability to hang on the wall. No wires...electrically sound. AC had already been removed from the windows for the season. The room had a 15" colored tv and telephone in the room. Breakfast included juce, coffee, tea, cereal, rolls, and crossiants. The area in Termini is not the most desirable. However, we felt fine walking to and from Termini during the day. Easy 1.5 block to Termini for toting suitcases. We decided to eliminate any fears of the area at night time by taking a taxi. Walking to and from seemed fine..may not want to hang out in at night. The cost was about 7 Euros from the Trevi Fountain. We found that booking a room in Rome was very expensive near the central sights with a higher star rating. However, if you are willing to walk or take the Metro to save money than in our opinion this hotel meets the needs.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: talmon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Mariano based upon its convenient location to Termini Station and walking distance to the ancient sites. The hotel far exceeded my expectations and was a most pleasant surprise upon our arrival in Rome. Our room was large and very clean. The desk staff all spoke English, were very friendly, and helpful and couldn't have been nicer during our stay. The area close to Termini is perceived as being slightly seedy, but we had no problems walking to our hotel at night in this area. The breakfasts in the mornings had the most delicious croissants, the sweetest juice and best hot chocolate. I would not hesitate to stay here again based on location, cleanliness and value for the money.

HotelInfo.Name: Mariano Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza Manfredo Fanti 19, 00185 Rome, Italy
